title: Pesticide Usage
description: Requirements for pesticide usage including application records, authorization/registration compliance, label compliance, pre-harvest interval adherence, MRL documentation, and destination market compliance

requirements.text: Are there up-to-date records of all pesticides applied during production (including soil and substrate pre-plant treatments, and any post-harvest treatments)? A ZERO POINT (NON-CONFORMANCE) DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THIS AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: Complete records exist for all pesticide applications
Records include pre-plant treatments of soil and substrates
Records include post-harvest treatments if applicable
Records are current and up-to-date
Records include date, pesticide name, active ingredient, target pest
Records include application rate, method, equipment used
Records include applicator name and growing area treated
Records are maintained and readily accessible
requirements.verificationExpectations: Monthly review of pesticide application records for completeness and accuracy
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Documentation completed immediately after each pesticide application

requirements.text: Are all pesticides applied, authorized/registered by the authority/government of the country of production? ANY DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THE AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: All pesticides applied are authorized/registered for use
Registration/authorization is from government authority of country of production
Pesticides are registered for the specific crop being grown
Pesticides are registered for use in indoor/protected agriculture (where applicable)
Registration documentation is maintained on file
Only approved pesticides are stored and available for use
Operation stays current with changes in pesticide registrations
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification that all pesticides in use are currently registered
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Verification of registration before first use of any new pesticide

requirements.text: Are all pesticides applied as recommended/directed in the label? ANY DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THE AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: All pesticides are applied according to label directions
Application rates comply with label specifications
Application methods follow label recommendations
Application timing follows label requirements
Target pests are listed on label
Crop type is listed on label for the pesticide used
Safety precautions and PPE requirements on label are followed
Labels are readily available for reference
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly verification that pesticide applications comply with label directions
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Pre-application review of label requirements, verification during application

requirements.text: Where harvesting is restricted by pre-harvest intervals, are required pre-harvest intervals on product labels, national (e.g., EPA) registration and any federal, state or local regulations and guidelines being adhered to? ANY DOWN SCORE IN THIS QUESTION RESULTS IN AN AUTOMATIC FAILURE OF THE AUDIT.
mandatoryStatements: Pre-harvest intervals (PHI) are identified for all pesticides used
PHI from pesticide label is followed
PHI from national registration requirements is followed
PHI from federal, state, and local regulations is followed
Most restrictive PHI is applied when multiple sources exist
Harvest scheduling considers all applicable PHIs
Records demonstrate PHI compliance for all harvests
Product is not harvested before PHI expires
requirements.verificationExpectations: Verification before each harvest that all applicable PHIs have been met
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily or per-harvest verification of PHI compliance, harvest scheduling accounts for PHIs

requirements.text: Is there documentation of pesticide Maximum Residue Limits (MRLs) CONFORMANCE considering country of destination, target crop(s), and active ingredients applied?
mandatoryStatements: MRL requirements are documented for destination countries
Documentation considers all destination markets for the product
MRLs are documented for specific crops being grown
MRLs are documented for all active ingredients applied
Documentation shows conformance or compliance strategy
Most restrictive MRLs are identified when selling to multiple markets
MRL information is current and from authoritative sources
Pesticide selection considers MRL compliance
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of MRL documentation and compliance strategy, update when markets or pesticides change
requirements.monitoringExpectations: MRL check before first use of any new pesticide, ongoing monitoring of MRL changes in destination markets

requirements.text: Where the MRLs of the destination countries are lower (stricter) than the country of production or where required by buyer, do test results show that Maximum Residue Limits (MRLs) of the intended markets are met?
mandatoryStatements: If destination MRLs are stricter than production country, residue testing is performed
If buyer requires MRL testing, testing is performed
Test results demonstrate compliance with destination market MRLs
Testing frequency is appropriate for risk and buyer requirements
Testing is performed by qualified accredited laboratory
Test results are documented and retained
Non-compliant results trigger corrective actions and product hold
requirements.verificationExpectations: Quarterly review of residue testing results and MRL compliance
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Testing performed per schedule, immediate review of results, product hold if non-compliant results received

capaInject: If pesticide application records incomplete or missing: immediate documentation of all recent applications, enhanced record-keeping system implementation
If unauthorized pesticide used: immediate cessation of use, product hold pending risk assessment, regulatory notification if required
If pesticide not applied per label: immediate investigation, product hold, residue testing if indicated, enhanced training within 7 days
If pre-harvest interval not met: immediate product hold, regulatory consultation, product disposition determination, enhanced harvest scheduling controls
If MRL documentation inadequate: develop MRL documentation within 14 days, verify all current pesticide uses comply with destination MRLs
If MRL testing shows non-compliance: immediate product hold, notification of customers and buyers, product disposition determination, revision of pesticide program
traceabilityInject: Pesticide application records must be traceable to specific growing areas, batches, and harvest lots
Pre-harvest interval compliance must be traceable to specific pesticide applications and harvest dates
MRL testing results must be traceable to specific lots, growing areas, and applications
Pesticide inventory must be traceable to purchase records and usage records
